head.title: Sharpen Your Pencils. We're Having a Quiz.

hedline.hl1: Sharpen Your Pencils. We're Having a Quiz.

abstract.p: Peter Applebome County Lines poses tongue-in-cheek quiz to parents as children prepare to return to school; drawing (M)

block.p: THE good news is you made it through a summer of constant rain, mosquito paranoia and summer camps that charge about what it costs to send a kid to Harvard. The bad news is you have to come back to the real world, which is far worse. Assuming you survived the first week of school, here's a back-to-school quiz to help you realign your brain with those of your children.
1. What is the correct weight of a backpack for a 90-pound sixth grader?
A. 20 pounds.
B. 35 pounds.
C. The approximate weight of Volumes A through P of the World Book encyclopedia.
D. The approximate weight of the defensive line of the New York Jets.

THE good news is you made it through a summer of constant rain, mosquito paranoia and summer camps that charge about what it costs to send a kid to Harvard. The bad news is you have to come back to the real world, which is far worse. Assuming you survived the first week of school, here's a back-to-school quiz to help you realign your brain with those of your children.
1. What is the correct weight of a backpack for a 90-pound sixth grader?
A. 20 pounds.
B. 35 pounds.
C. The approximate weight of Volumes A through P of the World Book encyclopedia.
D. The approximate weight of the defensive line of the New York Jets.
2. When should you start worrying about where your child will go to college?
A. When you get your baby's Apgar score.
B. When you realize by second grade that your kid will not get a basketball scholarship to UConn or a football scholarship to Florida State.
C. When the probation officer tells you there are no problem kids, just kids with problems.
D. When the other kids' early admission decisions start coming back.
3. Britney Spears, Mandy Moore, Christina Aguilera and all those other blonde nymphets on MTV are:
A. Appropriate role models for 9-year-old girls.
B. Appropriate role models for 45-year-old women.
C. Appropriate romantic fantasy figures for 13-year-old boys.
D. Appropriate romantic fantasy figures for 50-year-old men.
E. All of the above.
F. Houston, we have a problem.
4. Your children may be overscheduled if:
A. Your daughter goes to ballet class in her tai chi uniform.
B. You have school-optional weeks so your kids can catch up on lessons and practices.
C. From now on, you will only see them on Thanksgiving, Christmas and New Year's.
D. Your piano teacher is driving a Lexus and you're working three jobs.
5. Which of the following is not biologically essential to survival for the average high school student.
A. Oxygen.
B. Cell Phone.
C. Discman.
D. Diet Coke.
E. Their own car.
6. Which form of body piercing would force you to disown your child forever and deny any knowledge of his or her existence?
A. Navel.
B. Eye.
C. Nose.
D. Chin.
E. Tongue.
F. The ones we can't mention in this newspaper.
7. Nutritionists say a healthy breakfast for a high school student should consist of:
A. Cereal, fruit, juice, milk, vitamins.
B. Egg McMuffin, Coke and hash browns.
C. Chocolate donut and Jolt Cola.
D. Frappucino and Cheez Doodles
8. True or false?
A. Regis Philbin.
B. ''And he wrote every word of the college application essay himself!''
C. ''College admissions consultants? No, we didn't use any.''
D. ''Steroids? No, no one on the wrestling team is using any steroids.''
8. According to researchers, the optimal way for teenagers to do their homework is:
A. Wearing headphones, listening to Mozart sonatas.
B. Wearing headphones, listening to Nine Inch Nails.
C. Wearing headphones, listening to Nine Inch Nails and watching ''Dawson's Creek.''
D. Wearing headphones, listening to Nine Inch Nails, watching ''Dawson's Creek'' and talking to friends on the phone.
E. Your kid doesn't do homework.
9. What's the correct term for the kid with thick glasses, pocket protector and 800's on his math SAT's who stays up all night playing esoteric computer games.
A. Nerd.
B. Wonk.
C. Dweeb.
D. Geek.
E. Boss.
10. Write a short essay on the topic -- Paint Ball: Menace or Peril?
